result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Newkirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Civil Judgment filed
from agent Morrison with Order for unpaid obligations
filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz, Mary 14, 2015 waiver/plea and sentence held May 14, 2015
JOC to be amended to reflect 195 days jail credit.
Judgment of Conviction mailed to defendant at Dodge Correctional Institution and was returned marked "inmate not here"
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel
filed by Atty Yaskal

9:38 A.M., Defendant Kevin A Newkirk in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Court sentences defendant to: 2 years prison, 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision, concurrent, $518.00 costs, submit DNA Sample, 171 days sentence credit, if there is more credit parties to provide stip in 30 days, per Judge Miller defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program
Appointed Attorney Mark Lawton

Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared. Defendant not present. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested.  Return date scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 02:45 pm. Defendant present now. Court reset case for a preliminary hearing on May 14, 2015 at 9 a.m.

Defendant Kevin A Newkirk in court, in custody with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Reset requested by Atty. Frank for a plea at a return date that is after defendant's release from DCI (April 21, 2015).  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Dodge County Institution for 2/20/15 at 2:45 pm.
Hearing on February 20, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
